sections.title: Project Context & Role Clarity
sections.goal: Understand the intervieweesâ€™ involvement in Phoenix Feature Store and their perspectives on scope, deliverables, and alignment with Novereon values.
sample_questions: Can you describe your primary responsibilities in the Phoenix Feature Store project?
How does the scope of this project align with the 'Safety First' and 'Sustainable Velocity' values?
Which other departments have you collaborated with during the build phase?

sections.title: Technical Architecture & Data Flow
sections.goal: Explore the technical design of online/offline feature serving and how drift monitoring is integrated.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through the architecture from data ingestion to feature serving?
How do you ensure consistency between online and offline stores?
What mechanisms are in place to detect and respond to feature drift?

sections.title: Model CI/CD & Testing Strategy
sections.goal: Investigate model deployment pipelines, integration with QA processes, and risk-based testing approaches.
sample_questions: How is model CI/CD implemented in the context of Phoenix Feature Store?
What role does the QA team play in validating feature pipelines?
Can you give examples of applying policy POL-QA-014 in this project?

sections.title: Cross-System Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify dependencies on other Novereon projects and systems, and how they influence design and testing.
sample_questions: Which upstream or downstream systems does Phoenix depend on?
How have you coordinated with the Nimbus Observability team for monitoring and alerting?
Have you integrated any runbooks from related projects, e.g., RB-FS-034 Hotfix Rollback Procedure?

sections.title: Operational Readiness & SLAs
sections.goal: Assess preparations for operating the feature store at scale, including SLAs, runbooks, and incident response.
sample_questions: What are the key SLAs defined for Phoenix and how are they measured?
How do you plan to handle rollback in case of data or model issues?
Can you discuss any drills or simulations performed to validate readiness?

sections.title: Risk Management & Trade-offs
sections.goal: Understand major decisions, trade-offs, and risk mitigation strategies supported by evidence such as RFCs or tickets.
sample_questions: What were the most significant trade-offs made in the design of Phoenix?
How did you balance feature freshness against system stability?
Can you reference any RFCs or tickets that influenced these decisions?
